conclusion: Analyze the motion of the conductor rod MN in the magnetic field.
Identify the given information: magnetic field intensity B, distance AB is L, rod mass m, length L, initial velocity not given.
Determine the motion of the rod: magnetic force equals the weight of the rod, F = BIL, I = V/R.
Calculate the initial velocity of the rod: BIL = mg, I = mg/BL, V = mgR/BL.
Calculate the Joule heat Q: Q = I^2 R t, Q = (mgR/BL)^2 R t, Q = m^2 g^2 R^2/B^2 L^2.
Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force: F = BIL, F = B mg/BL L.
Combine the results: F = B mgL/BL.
Substitute the given values: B = 1 T, m = 1 kg, L = 1 m, F = 1 N.
Calculate the final velocity of the rod: V = mgR/BL, final velocity is 1 m/s.
Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force at the initial moment: initial velocity V = 0, F = BIL = 1 N.
Conclude the final answer: magnitude of the Ampere force on the rod at the initial moment is 1 N.
